Pre-Game Insights: Didier Deschamps is expected to make numerous changes to his France side ahead of the visit of Chile to the Stade Velodrome on Tuesday night.
Kylian Mbappe was among the starters and should keep his place, but there could be as many as eight or nine alterations for this encounter.
Mike Maignan is likely to come back in between the sticks.
The entire back four could change, as central defensive pairing Dayot Upamecano and Benjamin Pavard are set to make way for William Saliba and Ibrahima Konate.
Olivier Giroud remains in good form for Milan and could also come into the side here, with his contribution to the French setup still vitally important.
Warren Zaire-Emery, who got just his second cap against Germany after making his debut in the 14-0 win over Gibraltar, may keep his place.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Stade Velodrome.
The final score was 3-2 to France.
Others: The match was a friendly international match.
The match was played on March 26, 2024 at 8pm UK.
